section.title: ScriptSender
section.para:
The sender can be used to send a single message using a JSR 223
See
for more details on JSR 223 specification.
compliant script.

The target of the sender is a path to the file where the script is implemented. To specify the scripting language engine there is a engine property. The message and it's headers are passed to the script via script binding and should be available as variables or objects instances, according to the scripting language.

The following table shows the senders properties.
ScriptSender properties
Property name Description Required Default value
engine A scripting language engine name. groovy is available out-of-the-box.
No -

example.title: An example of ScriptSender configuration
example.programlisting: <sender class="ScriptSender"> <target>/tmp/script.groovy</target> <property name="engine" value="groovy"/> </sender> ... <messages> <message content="Soylent green"> <header name="what" value="people"/> </message> </messages>
println message.payload + " is made out of " + message.headers['what'];
